summary: This is an email chain from December 2019 among U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) personnel discussing media inquiries about missing video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following his earlier attempted suicide. The emails reference a court hearing for defendant Tartaglione, who was Epstein's cellmate, and concerns about the preservation of evidence.

persons.name: Jonathan Bandler
persons.context: Journalist for Lohud who was in court for the Tartaglione hearing and emailed the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking clarification about missing video footage from Epstein's cell after his attempted suicide.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: A defendant in a separate case who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the MCC; his lawyer raised the issue of missing video footage from Epstein's cell during a court hearing.

connections.description: Tartaglione was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Tartaglione Court Hearing
events.description: A court hearing for defendant Tartaglione where his lawyer raised the issue that video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell following an earlier attempted suicide appears not to have been preserved.

events.title: Epstein's Earlier Attempted Suicide
events.description: A prior incident where Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC); video surveillance from his cell was reportedly not preserved.

keyFacts: Video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell following an earlier attempted suicide was reported as missing or not preserved.
The issue was raised in court by the lawyer for defendant Tartaglione, who was Epstein's cellmate at the MCC.
A U.S. Attorney's Office spokesman reportedly confirmed to the press that the tapes were missing, contrary to internal directions.
Journalist Jonathan Bandler sought clarification from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the status of the video evidence.
